definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
and/moreover/yet/for the time being/to be about to/both (... and...)
lit. like maggots feeding on a corpse (idiom)/fig. fixed on sth/to cling on without letting go/to pester obstinately

sentences.english: The maggots also provide a cool, pre-industrial expiration date.
sentences.chinese: 而这蛆还有一个很酷的，工业化以前的终止日期。

sentences.english: The dreaded wood-eating shipworm is invading northern Europe's Baltic Sea.
sentences.chinese: 可怕的吃木头的船蛆正在侵袭北欧的波罗的海。

sentences.english: Let them sleep in their maggoty beds.
sentences.chinese: 让他们在爬满了蛆的床上长眠去吧。

sentences.english: When Mind Maggots comes into play, choose and discard any number of creature cards.
sentences.chinese: 当心灵蛆进场时，选择弃掉任意数量的生物牌。

sentences.english: Maggot medicine, in fact, has a long history.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，蛆疗法由来已久。

sentences.english: Sometimes it was full of maggots and weevils.
sentences.chinese: 有时，饼干里生满了蛆和象鼻虫。

sentences.english: For canker vice the sweetest buds doth love.
sentences.chinese: 因为恶蛆最爱那甜蜜的嫩蕊。

sentences.english: They're creepy, slimy and altogether ooky, but maggots can save your life.
sentences.chinese: 蛆给人的感觉总是很恶心，但是它们却可以用来救人。

sentences.english: Patriotism is a maggot in their heads.
sentences.chinese: 爱国主义是他们脑袋里的蛆。
让我们不要用“蛆”这个词。

definition: insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
